deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}"?

licenses.authorProfile: Link to author website or profile, if available
licenses.derivativeSourceUrl: Link to the original source, if this is a derivative work
licenses.derivativeSourceUrlHelper: Note that a derivative work is one which is not only based on a previous work, but which also contains sufficient new, creative content to entitle it to its own copyright.
licenses.originalObjectUrl: Link to the source website, if available

nothingHereYetAction: Press the action button to begin
alsoSearchEnglish: Also search for names in English

exercises.replacementsInfoText: Optionally, you can also select an exercise that should replace this one (e.g. because it was submitted twice, or similar). This will replace the exercise in routines as well as training logs, instead of just deleting it. These changes will also propagate to any instance that syncs the exercises from this one.
exercises.replacementsSearch: Search for an exercise or copy and paste a known ID into the field and click on the "load" button.
exercises.notEnoughRights: You can only contribute exercises if your account is older than {{days}} days and have verified your email
exercises.whatVariationsExist: Which variations of this exercise exist, if any?
exercises.filterVariations: Enter exercise name to filter variations
exercises.identicalExercisePleaseDiscard: If you notice an exercise that is identical to the one you're adding, please discard your draft and edit that exercise instead.
exercises.compatibleImagesCC: Images must be compatible with the CC BY SA license. If in doubt, upload only photos you've taken yourself.
exercises.checkInformationBeforeSubmitting: Please check that the information you entered is correct before submitting the exercise
exercises.cacheWarning: Due to caching it might take some time till the changes are visible throughout the application.
exercises.successfullyUpdated: The exercise was successfully updated. Due to caching it might take some time till the changes are visible throughout the application.
exercises.exerciseNotTranslatedBody: This exercise is currently not available in the currently selected language. Do you want to contribute a translation?
exercises.deleteExerciseBody: Do you want to delete the exercise "{{name}}"? You can either delete the current {{language}} translation or the complete exercise with all translations, images, etc.
exercises.missingExerciseDescription: Help out the community by contributing it!
exercises.notesHelpText: Notes are short comments on how to perform the exercise such as "keep your body straight"

nutrition.copyPlan: Make a copy of this plan
nutrition.onlyLoggingHelpText: Only track calories. Check the box if you only want to log your calories and don't want to setup a detailed nutritional plan with specific meals
nutrition.useGoalsHelpTextLong: This allows you to set general goals for energy, protein, carbohydrates or fat for the plan. Note that if you setup a detailed meal plan, these values will take precedence.
nutrition.planDeleteInfo: This will delete all nutrition diary entries as well
nutrition.mealDeleteInfo: Nutrition diary entries to this meal will not be deleted and will appear under "other logs"
nutrition.logThisMeal: Log this meal as-is to the nutrition diary
nutrition.logThisMealItem: Log this ingredient as-is to the nutrition diary

forms.supportedImageFormats: Only JPEG, PNG, WEBP and AVIF files below 20Mb are supported
forms.minValue: The value for this field has to be higher than {{value}}
forms.maxValue: The value for this field has to be less than {{value}}
forms.maxLessThanMin: The max value has to be bigger than the minimum
forms.endBeforeStart: The end value cannot be before the start

name: Name
noResultsDescription: No results found for this query, consider reducing the number of filters.

routines.minLengthRoutine: The routine needs to be at least {{number}} weeks long
routines.maxLengthRoutine: The routine can be at most {{number}} weeks long
routines.deleteDayConfirmation: This will remove all sets, exercises and progression rules
routines.fitDaysInWeekHelpText: This setting controls how your routine's days are scheduled across multiple weeks. If enabled, the days will repeat in a weekly cycle. For example, a routine with workouts on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday will continue this pattern on the following Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. If disabled, the days will follow sequentially without regard to the start of a new week. This is useful for routines that don't follow a strict weekly schedule.
routines.needsLogsToAdvanceHelpText: If you select this option, the routine will only progress to the next scheduled day if you've logged a workout for the current day. If this option is not selected, the routine will automatically advance to the next day regardless of whether you logged a workout or not.
routines.progressionNeedsReplace: One of the previous entries must have a replace operation
routines.exerciseHasProgression: This exercise has progression rules and can't be edited here. To do so, click the button.
routines.roundingHelp: Set the default rounding for weight and repetitions (this is specially useful when using the percentage increase step in the progression). This will apply to all new sets but can be changed individually in the progression form. Leave empty to disable rounding.
routines.weightLogNotPlanned: Saving logs to a date for which no workouts were planned.
routines.logsFilterNote: Note that only entries with a weight unit of kg or lb and repetitions are charted, other combinations such as time or until failure are ignored here
routines.confirmRestDayHelpText: Please note that all sets and exercises will be removed when you mark a day as a rest day.
routines.impressionHelpText: This form records your workout results (reps, weight, etc.) for each exercise. Changes you make here, like removing or swapping exercises, only affect the specific logs you save and and won't change your overall routine. Only rows with values for either weight or repetitions are saved.
routines.requirementsHelpText: Select the workout results (from previous logs) that must be met for this rule to take effect
routines.repeatHelpText: Check the check box if you want this rule to continue to apply to subsequent workouts until you define a new one
routines.templatesHelpText: Templates are a way to save your routine for later use and as a starting point for further routines. You can't edit templates, but you can duplicate them and make changes to the copy (as well as converting them back to a regular routine, of course).
routines.publicTemplateHelpText: Public templates are available to all users.

measurements.unitFormHelpText: The unit in which the category will be measured, such as cm or %
measurements.deleteInfo: This will delete the category as well as all its entries
